meanings.definition: The state or quality of being long.
meanings.sent1: The longness of the snake amazed the children at the zoo.
meanings.sent2: The longness of the hallway made it seem never-ending.
meanings.sent3: The longness of the line at the ice cream truck was comical.
meanings.sent4: The longness of the shadows in the evening sun stretched across the field.
meanings.sent5: The longness of the giraffe's neck was truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: The extent of something from end to end.
meanings.sent1: She measured the longness of the table with a tape measure.
meanings.sent2: The longness of the river seemed to stretch for miles.
meanings.sent3: The longness of the scarf surprised her when she unraveled it.
meanings.sent4: The longness of the bridge connected the two sides of the canyon.
meanings.sent5: The longness of the train tracks disappeared into the distance.

meanings.definition: The duration of time that something lasts.
meanings.sent1: The longness of the movie made it hard to sit through.
meanings.sent2: The longness of the summer days allowed for plenty of outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: The longness of the meeting made everyone restless.
meanings.sent4: The longness of the wait for the concert felt like an eternity.
meanings.sent5: The longness of the vacation was a welcome break from work.
